net.sourceforge.seqware.common.util.workflowtools

Class WorkflowTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.seqware.common.util.workflowtools.WorkflowTools

  • public class WorkflowTools
extends Object
    This class provides methods for dealing with Pegasus workflow log directories for example watching a directory to detect when a workflow has failed or finished.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    boconnor

      ReturnValue watchWorkflow(String statusCmd, String statusDir, int cycles)
      This method allows you to monitor a running Pegasus workflow using a statusCmd (typically something like "pegasus-status -l dir" and, if something goes wrong, it will return a ReturnValue with exit status of ReturnValue.FAILURE, ReturnValue.PROCESSING if still running, and ReturnValue.SUCCESS if finished OK.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorkflowState

        public ReturnValue getWorkflowState(String statusCmd)
        This method examines a Pegasus log directory using the status command provided and will encode the state of the workflow in the ReturnValue object, running as ReturnValue.PROCESSING, failed as ReturnValue.FAILURE, and success as ReturnValue.SUCCESS.
        Parameters:
        statusCmd - a String object.
        Returns:
        ReturnValue

      • watchWorkflow

        public ReturnValue watchWorkflow(String statusCmd,
                        String statusDir)
        This method allows you to monitor a running Pegasus workflow using a statusCmd (typically something like "pegasus-status -l dir" and, if something goes wrong, it will return false. This method won't return until a workflow either finishes normally or terminates in error.
        Parameters:
        statusCmd - a String object.
        statusDir - a String object.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating success or failure, use other methods to get details of failure

      • watchWorkflow

        public ReturnValue watchWorkflow(String statusCmd,
                        String statusDir,
                        int cycles)
        This method allows you to monitor a running Pegasus workflow using a statusCmd (typically something like "pegasus-status -l dir" and, if something goes wrong, it will return a ReturnValue with exit status of ReturnValue.FAILURE, ReturnValue.PROCESSING if still running, and ReturnValue.SUCCESS if finished OK. This method will watch the workflow for at least the numbers of cycles specified (each last for 5 seconds) before returning the ReturnValue.
        Parameters:
        statusCmd - a String object.
        statusDir - a String object.
        cycles - a int.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating success or failure, use other methods to get details of failure

      • getFailedJobsInfo

        public ReturnValue[] getFailedJobsInfo(String statusDir)
        This method will examine a Pegasus DAX log directory for a given workflow and identify the log files for jobs that failed. It will then report these back as an array of RetunValue objects
        Parameters:
        statusDir - a String object.
        Returns:
        an array of ReturnValue objects.
